quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Ugh, man. My delts are blasted. I wish they had a chart for how much protein powder to scoop for a 180 pound man with no fat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Protein powder, huh? You cut it with water? Why don’t you just take estrogen? [swallows powder] [coughs] There you go boys. See how papa takes care of you? [kisses bicep] Mwah.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I remember when people thought biceps were all that. They’d flex them all night at the discotheque.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, I bet you think it’s all about core, huh?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, please.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Core’s critical. There are four tenets of pilates that I live my life by. One – lengthen. Two – elongate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Listen, guys, I think we all want to know the same thing, right? Who’s the strongest? Well, there’s only one way to solve that – flat curl contest.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, here we go everybody. May the manliest man win. Go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Feast on this, Lewis.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I love the burn. The burn is where I live.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Come on, Gabe, you can’t handle his hamstrings. You’re getting hypno-thigh-zed.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Speed set. One. Two.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Here, this is for your elbows, for your elbows.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You’re welcome.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Five. Six.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Quick phone call from you guys, keep going,

quotes.speaker: All
quotes.line: Eight, nine, ten.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: We got it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Very funny Jim.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Yeah, Jim. Way to mock us for perfecting our bodies.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Everyone, conference room, now. [Dwight and Gabe stand up, falling over]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, easy there, grandpa.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I don’t need your help.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay. You don’t need my help?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Here, here… Just…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Morning.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Somebody left in such a hurry this morning that she forgot… these.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You know the only thing more delicious than your feet is the feast that I am going to prepare for everyone.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy, if you’re gonna hang out for a while, uh…

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What’s this?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: This dumb rule Robert made, he just wants visitors to sign in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Is this Robert’s attempt to embarrass me?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: No, of course not. It’s just – I think it’s like if we make an exception for you, then we have to make an exception for the water guy, and then, it’s like, where does it end? So just… [puts visitors tag on Andy]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why is it when other people spend all their time at the office, they’re rewarded for it, and when I do it, I am told it’s a little much? …Is it because I am not an employee anymore, because that’s what it feels like.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, well, enjoy the alumni game.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Good, we have a deal?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Thanks Janet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thanks so much Earl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow, simultaneous sale.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And they said it couldn’t be done. Boom!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Screw ‘em.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Lot going on guys. What’s happening?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Binghamton branch closed last night and their clients are up for grabs.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That was a fine branch. Things are really bad under Robert California, I guess. It’s like a festival of poo.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, hey, come on, language.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, and we’re not interested in your sour grapes, okay? Jim, tell him where he can stick his grapes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: In the fridge.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, Jim, the butt, in his butt.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sorry, man, I can’t focus on zingers. There’s too many potential clients.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: You two better watch yourselves.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, the Syracuse branch can’t be happy you’re taking New York clients.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Shh… shh… [vomits in trash can]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Robert?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Why did Binghamton close?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Can everyone just, please… I had a one-man saturnalia last night, in celebration of the finalization of my divorce. I got into a case of Australian reds, and – how should I say this – Columbian whites. What – what is this about, uh, Binghamton?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: The branch closed. Forever.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Closing the Binghamton branch never occurred to me before today. Or, I guess, last night. But, in vino veritas as they say, I’m not gonna start doubting my drunken self now.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I got your voicemail. From – from last night.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Wonderful.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: And the answer… is yes, yes, yes, yes, and never. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Pam, when’s the last time you lived so intensely that your brain literally couldn’t hold the memories in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, it was this summer –

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Apparently, I left a phone message for Nellie last night, and I need you to find out what I said.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um, I am a little busy.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Yes, ‘course. Why don’t you list the things that would keep you from helping me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I can make you a list.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Let’s do it now. What’s number one?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Why don’t I help you now?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: There we go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Who the hell are Jim Halpert and Dwight Schrute?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Jim, Dwight, what are your last names?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And you are…

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Harry Jannerone, Dunder Mifflin Syracuse.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: What the hell’s all this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh, cherries jubilee over homemade gelato.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: You live well down here in P.A. I want to talk to you guys right now. Oh, and Lloyd Gross too. Which one’s that guy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: The salesmen have a commission cap, but we figured out a way around it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Lloyd Gross is a fictional salesman we invented to – how do I put this – steal from the company. Embezzle. To commit fraud.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, it sounds sketchy, but it helps us get more money.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam made a drawing of Lloyd. He is a blend of all the salesman. [shows sketch]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [pointing at Toby] There he is. That’s Lloyd.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Me?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Yeah, you.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Where do you get off crossing state lines?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Now, we’re actually a lot closer to Binghamton than you are. Kimosabe.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I like to think Lloyd Gross is a no-nonsense guy who doesn’t back down from anybody. And he calls people “Kimosabe”.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: They’re New York. We’re New York. State line is the dividing line. That's the way it’s always been.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: There’s actually not a rule that says that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That’s true.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: That’s true. There’s no rule. You can check the employee handbook.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Oh, can I check the employee handbook Lloyd? Well, does it say anything about me choking a man with my bare hands?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, no? Are you kidding me? You told me there was a rule. I could’ve choked so many people by now.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Stay out of my state. It’s in your best interest to stay out of my state.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I’ve seen guys like you. Big guys who like to push the little guys around. Lloyd Gross eats bullies like you for breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Just stay out of New York, Lloyd.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey, text from the old wife. Gonna take that. [runs outside]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How about this? How about we just ask Robert? Can we all agree that maybe the C.E.O should decide this?

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Robert’s here. Look at us. Bickering like schoolgirls, looking around the room for things to hit each other with. I don’t think we were doing that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Chair, lamp, plant, table leg, Jim’s leg.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Where’s the Advil, Jim? I think I’ve hit my limit on the Tylenol – Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Doing dishes] Sorry, not Jim.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Andrew, what do we have to do to get rid of you? Hire you back and send Erin back to Florida?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Message received loud and clear. Just have to get the caramelized sugar off the pan before it dries.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Oh, for god –

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Robert California. What a surprise you’re here in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Harry…

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: So why would you close Binghamton down without a transition plan in place?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: How do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I forgot, a… a pan, uh –

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no, kid, stay there, do your dishes, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Harry there is a time for every decision, predetermined many years ago. There’s no benefit in questioning why this particular decision seems… so poorly timed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, what are you deciding? We get a say.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Listen, Robert, I don’t have time. There’s a big client in play. Prestige direct mail solutions –

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don’t listen to him.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Used to be Binghamton’s –

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: I want it, it’s mine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Prestige is ours. Okay, they’re responsible for half of the junk mail on the eastern seaboard. We get them. We already put a call into them, Robert.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: We need you to make a decision.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Make a decision.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I have decided. Neither of you are to have any contact with either Prestige or any other Binghamton client until I have figured out how to divide things up. As Solomon once said… [Andy walks out]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Some bizarre energy in this place today. Robert is going off the rails, making some funky decisions. Like why is nobody gonna call on Prestige? That is a huge client. [walking to car] I mean, they could give their business to the first person to walk in the door. Could be any idiot. Any idiot at all.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Shaping a company is, in a sense, similar to training a geisha. You have to mold not merely the physical form, but also the character. The two must harmonize. Are they still there? [camera pans to right, Harry, Dwight, and Jim watching Robert in conference room] They want a decision who gets the big client. Well, they can wait. I’ll still be talking about geishas long past their bedtime. You know, I trained as one.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Is it just me or is our boss a freakin’ weirdo? [stands up, walks outside] I’m gonna get some air.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, you know what would be really dastardly? If we snuck out of here and got to the client first.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Gets up and looks out Nellie’s office window] He’s running!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wha – what is this supposed to be?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It’s a monkey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim, great real. This is not a monkey. It’s got a hula skirt and a blue nose.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hold on, hold on. Is this him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is that him?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s him! Do something! Get out!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What? What am I gonna do? I don’t –

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go slash his tires! Go dent his hood. [Jim opens passenger door] That’s it? Oh, that’s great. That’s like a five second delay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Come on, let’s go! Does this thing have turbo? Nitrous? Hit the nos.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Nos? You mean like in fast and furious?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, yeah, definitely have nos.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hit the nos.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Brace yourself. 3… 2…

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Got it. Go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: 1. Here we go! [turns on wipers]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hello. Andy Bernard to see the C.E.O.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Oh, do you have an appointment?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, I do not.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Okay, I think I can squeeze you in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Seriously? ‘Cause I could just be anyone. I mean, I thought I was gonna have to convince you.

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: He’s really not that busy.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Is there someone here to see me?

quotes.speaker: Receptionist
quotes.line: Yes, this man.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Come on in. [Andy walks in]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So…what do you make of this Robert California guy? I mean, what does a guy like that do on an average weeknight?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh. Oh, I’ll tell you what he does.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: : [walks in] Hello! Hello, my clucking hens. Got room for another in the roost? Huh? Don’t worry, I won’t lay an egg.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: : Robert sent me to take over if Pam fails. If? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: : I have been crunching numbers all day. Math is for boys. I need girl talk.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Did someone say girl talk?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Sometimes I wonder if I have ovaries in my scrotum, because I am great at girl talk.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Have you guys been watching any good Korean soap operas? I’m pretty deep into Hee-Jungcinderella girl. Although, I definitely fast-forward through the young-Tae storylines.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Do you think I’d like that, or is it important to have an Asian fetish?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Uh, I think you’re gonna need to have an Asian fetish. Yeah. [chuckles] It’ll be upsetting if you don’t.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’m a former paper executive. I know the product. I know the margins. I can save you 25% on your costs.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Why haven’t I heard of you? You got any references?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No. I’m a rogue.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Which is the best part. That means you will be my first customer and your business will get 100% of my attention. Now… [pulls out business card] I have written down my personal phone number. You call this anytime.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Every salesman I’ve ever met has given me his personal phone number.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Of course they have. Which is why I’m giving you a key to my house. [gives key to C.E.O] Whatever you need – anytime, night or day – you just stop on by.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: You want me to drive to your house if I need paper.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Maybe you just want someone to talk to. Maybe… you need a place to crash for a couple of days. My wireless password is eat pray love. Easy to remember.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ready? Go! Go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go. [takes off belt, ties doors together]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Running] Ahhh! [Slides into elevator]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You all right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah. [Doors about to close, hand stops them] Oh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ah! [Harry walks in]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Dwight pushes button for floor two] Dwight, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go, go! Take the stairs! Now!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Just run! Take the stairs!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don’t even know where the stairs are!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I’ll stall him. Go!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: God!

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: [Dwight jumping] What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I’m gonna activate the seismic failsafe. We’ll be stuck between floors for hours. [pants fall down] Oh. [Jim runs in] My pants fell down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: My pants fell down! I don’t have a belt!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [walks into lobby] Hello, sir. Good day. Dwight K. Schrute. Dunder Mifflin, Scranton. Forgive my pants, they fell down. An appointment with Mr. Ramish, please. Right now is fine. No, no, no, I was here first. Dwight K. Schrute. Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: What’s going on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well –

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Mr. Ramish, Harry Jannerone. Dunder Mifflin, Syracuse –

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I was here first.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I already made an appointment… with your secretary.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Let me stop you all right here. I’ve already picked a new paper supplier.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait, it’s not D.M Utica, is it?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: No, no, it’s not Dunder Mifflin at all actually. It’s… Big Red Paper Company.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Big Red Paper Company?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Ramish
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes, yes, yes!

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Give me a cup of coffee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Me too. Or do you also have a monopoly on thirst?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, guys. It didn’t work out for any of us, so… we’re still on the same team. Let me get these.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. Let him get his own. It’s Syracuse money.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: You know, your partner’s got a lotta attitude. But I like that. How long you guys been dating?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Jim couldn’t land me in a thousand years.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: But you’re saying there’s a chance.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Walks into conference room] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I stole Nellie’s phone.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Excellent. Excellent. Though troubling that your first instinct is thievery.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What do you want from me?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Now we get to the bottom of Nellie’s “yes, yes, yes, yes, never.”

quotes.speaker: Phone
quotes.line: Hi, Nell, it’s mom. Do keep your chin up. It can’t be as bad as you described.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Oh yes it can.

quotes.speaker: Phone
quotes.line: This is MasterCard. You are over the limit. Send the minimum payment of $448 by Monday, or we will be forced to send it to collections.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Shopaholic.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sounds like it.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phone
quotes.line: Hi, sis. Is your boss still hitting on you?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Phone
quotes.line: This is Annie from second nests. I’m sorry, but the Romanian orphanage felt more comfortable with a two-person nuclear family than a single mother, so, we’re gonna hold out for that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, that’s enough. [grabs phone]

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Pam, we need to get to the bottom of this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, no, no!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No, come on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Robert! Okay, oops! I deleted them all. They’re all deleted.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Pam, Pam, you’ve completely bungled this!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ah. Ahh. [walks out]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Can I do it, Pam? Can I put off a gold Arabian sandal?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Um… yes. Definitely. With your hair –

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Certainly. Um… you dropped your cell phone.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, gosh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Thank you. I’m… so stupid.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No. My goodness. You have a lot going on. With Robert and everything.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh, god, Pam. Don’t get me started.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, I will not.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: You’ve just got me started. Robert… is… a filthy beast. I mean, don’t you get the feeling, he’s just thinking of fifteen different ways to do you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Well –

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I mean, the man talks of nothing but sex.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But sometimes he talks about flesh… and bacchanals.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: I cannot even tell you what he left on my phone last night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No… don’t. Just put it out of your mind.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Pam, what is your address? I’m gonna send you a pair of these gold harem shoes. Oh, no. You don’t –

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh yes. Come on, a little gold Arabian slipper.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Things are looking up. I might be a mother soon. I have MasterCard right where I want them. And… I have a new friend. A friend. At work.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [Erin opens door] Erin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: There’s a call for you on line one.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Who is it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: He says salvation. No last name.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Yeah, hello?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [in car] You once put me on a list of the losers in the office. Well, this loser just got your biggest client to give him all their business. So hire me back, that business is yours. Don’t, and I will find another buyer.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: You’re blackmailing me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It’s just business.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Ah, well, I will not be blackmailed by some ineffectual, privileged, effete, soft-penised debutante. You wanna start a street fight with me, bring it on. You’re gonna be surprised by how ugly it gets. You don’t even know my real name. I’m the *bleep* lizard king. [disconnects]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Whoa. Well I gave him a chance. [gets out of car, walks to house]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: [opens door] Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You got a minute?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Um… I’m in the middle of a piano lesson.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I wanted to see if I could interest you in an investment. Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin. [closes door] Now… why would I want that? It’s worth half of what it was three years ago.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Exactly. And you know better than anyone that with the right management it could be worth twice what you would pay for it today.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Why don’t you come in? [Andy walks in, closes door]

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: So what would you do if you weren’t selling paper?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, man, I’d have to sell beets. Probably submit them for competitions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah! I know it sounds stupid, but nationals has always kinda been a dream of mine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How have we never talked about this before? Wait. You don’t even care about nationals.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Nothing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don’t know. I’ve always wanted to own a bike shop, but what about you?

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: I’d like to sell one big thing, you know? Like… a plane. One sale, I’m out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That sounds lovely.

quotes.speaker: Harry
quotes.line: Anyway, Robert’s gonna run this company into the ground, so… We won’t be doing this in six months.
